project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition

Searching from Customer Portal, when retrieving the results and browsing the different pages, when you click on a particular KB and then go "Back to results" it will got to page 1.
h3. Suggestion

This is not useful for customers as clicking on Back to Results should return to the page you were looking at  and not restart the search and go back to page 1.
fields.summary: Keep page selection of the search when clicking on a knowledge base page

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Due to customer adding screenshots to requests that may contain PHI/PII, we cannot allow these screenshots to be transmitted via the automated email notifications to watchers/assignees. 

An admin function to toggle the option to remove the attachment thumbnail from all email notifications would be very useful to remain in compliance.
fields.summary: Ability to Disable Attachments in Email Notifications

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The link for more Groovy scripts example in https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicemanagementserver/groovy-scripts-1044784444.html is a dead link.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicemanagementserver/groovy-scripts-1044784444.html.
 # Go to the bottom of the page and click on the link to get more Groovy script examples.

h3. Expected Results
Users are redirected to a page with some Groovy script example

h3. Actual Results
Users are redirected to https://documentation.riada.se/display/ICV50/Groovy+script+examples which is a dead link

h3. Workaround
Use https://documentation.mindville.com/insight/latest/groovy-script-examples-33466725.html
fields.summary: The link for more Groovy scripts example in https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicemanagementserver/groovy-scripts-1044784444.html is a dead link

fields.description:
At the moment the Insight automation rules do not show any audit log over the result (passed/failed) with root cause such as it works in Automation for Jira.

It would be very helpful to add such feature.

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
In a scenario where multiple custom fields (both normal and read-only) are in action with having inbound references to each other the issues indexing doesn't happen when read only fields are updated because of changes in the main custom field.

h4.Use Case Scenario: 
When we update an issue and change Insight custom field say "*Test-1*", and have other two read only custom fields say  "*Test-2*" and "*Test-3*" having inbound references to "*Test-1*", they automatically get updated since they have inbound references to each other's fields.

- This change will not be picked up by Jira when we perform "Issue Search" in JQL.

- After we changed values for fields "*Test-1*" and "*Test-2*" as an example say, we changed custom field value from "*Vehicle Engineering*" to "*Body Engineering*" but JQL still finds issue with the old value.

- This is because Insight read only field update didn't trigger re-index and hence the indexes are not uptodate. Once we re-index project manually changes are reflected.

h4.Observations:
- The issue is reproducible, even with the latest version version of Insight (9.0.2).
- It seems to be due to the fact that the Second Read Only CF is being populated AFTER the issue is actually being indexed.
- Read Only custom field value updates following an Issue Created/Updated event, but does not fire this event by itself. As a result:
** The ISSUE_UPDATE event is fired.
** The Insight Object CF is indexed.
** The 1st Read Only CF is updating, and possibly indexed (not always!)
** The 2nd Read Only CF is updated per changes in the 1st Read Only CF - but Issue indexing was performed already and hence it is not being indexed.

h4. Suggestions:
- It seems to be like a race conditions, when all these changed happen in quick time, so we need to have functionality to ensure that "*Insight Read Only*" custom field updates should trigger the issue indexing. This will fix these type of issues and indexes remain consistent.
fields.summary: Insight Read only custom field updates should trigger re-indexing of the issue

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

The Object View's page layout can be customized (see [Customizing the object view layout|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicemanagementserver/customizing-the-object-view-layout-1044784527.html]). If there are multiple Attachments panels, however, they will both display all attachments on the Object if there are any attachments, unless they are filtered. 

It would be helpful to be able to separate attachments into different Attachments panels (for example: Documents, Images, Videos, etc.) for easier sorting.

h3. Suggested Solution

Add an option in the panel configuration for the Attachments panel to filter the attachments shown. Admins could then configure these filters to display only attachments with specific file extensions, for example.
fields.summary: As an Insight admin, I want to customize the Object View page layout with multiple Attachments panels for different attachment types

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

This issue can only be reproduced with the bundled version of Insight
 It was reproduced in this enviorment
 - Insight 9.0.2
 - Jira Core 8.15.1
 - Jira Service Management 4.15.1

If you create an text area paragraph attribute, not normal textfields and type P and V it will lead you to the Jira advanced road map menu. This is done in the object view when you edit the attribute.

Advanced roadmap is bundled with it as well
 <plugin>
 <key>com.atlassian.teams</key>
 <name>Advanced Roadmaps Team Management</name>
 <version>8.17.1</version>
 <vendor>Atlassian</vendor>
 <status>ENABLED</status>
 <vendor-url>[http://www.atlassian.com/]</vendor-url> <framework-version>2</framework-version>
 <bundled>User installed</bundled>
 </plugin>
 <plugin>
h3. [^Screen Recording 2021-08-10 at 17.15.49.mov]
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a text area attribute
 # Type "PV" in the text area attribute, in the object view

h3. Expected Results

PV should appear in the attribute and it should stay there
h3. Actual Results

Takes you to the advanced Jira Roadmap
h3. Workaround

No workaround
fields.summary: Insight Typing "PV" in Textfield attribute takes you to Jira advance roadmap

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When creating/editing a series on a JSM report, it will be difficult to handle long JQL filters since the popup is fixed, unresizable, and difficult to manipulate even with zooming in and out.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Click to create or edit a series on one report
 # On filter's filter write a long JQL filter

h3. Expected Results

The popup should be responsive and allow the user to scroll down to continue to edit the filter.
h3. Actual Results

The popup is fixed, unresizable, and difficult to manipulate even with zooming in and out.

[^popup issue 2021-08-10 at 11.37.23.mov]
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: creating/editing a series of a report isn't feasible with long filters

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Discovery tool fails to connect with error *Cannot connect with credentials* for Linux machines when the credentials are setup with *RSA key with passphrase*. Credential of RSA Key without passphrase works fine.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Setup Discovery tool to scan a Linux server
 # Choose *Type: SSH_RSA* in *Credentials* tab
 # Use *RSA Key* and *Passphrase* as mentioned in [Credentials|https://documentation.mindville.com/display/IDV215/Credentials]
 # Use [Using RSA Keys|https://documentation.mindville.com/display/IDV215/Using+RSA+Keys] to setup the RSA key
 # Try to test the connection with the *SSH_RSA* credentials along with passphrase

h3. Expected Results

Discovery tool should connect successfully on Linux machines that use *RSA Key* with *Passphrase* as login method
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the Discovery.log file:
{noformat}
Failed to connect durring to: Wrong passphrase

Failed to connect durring to: Access is denied. (Exception from HRESULT: 0x80070005 (E_ACCESSDENIED))
The RPC server is unavailable. (Exception from HRESULT: 0x800706BA)
Access is denied. (Exception from HRESULT: 0x80070005 (E_ACCESSDENIED))
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Generate RSA key without passphrase to ensure successful login
fields.summary: Insight Discovery tool fails to connect with error Cannot connect with credentials

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When creating or editing an Insight Object with an attribute TextValue, there is an Insert Code Snippet feature to insert code blocks.

Whichever language we pick up, it, the Language will be display as _*<not set>*_
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Create an Object Type
 * Create an object with a TextArea Type Value.
 * In the TextArea value, we click on "Insert Code Snippet"
 ** Set Language to Java, for instance.
 ** Insert some Java code, Save and Create
 !Object Creation.png|thumbnail!

 * Edit the object and double click on the code block to edit it.
 * Language is set to <not set>
 !Object View.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results

Code snippet windows should retain the Language used. In this example, it should be set to Java.
h3. Actual Results

Language is set to *_<not set>_*
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Code Snippet within Insight Object does not keep the Language selected

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
basic search broken when child object type inherited contains attributes with same name but different select options

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an object type (ex. test object type) and set on it *Let the attributes be inherited by object type children* and *Set the object type as abstract*.
 # Create  2 other object types having as parent the test object type previously created.
 # In both the child object type create an attribute with same name (ex. attribute) of type Default and type value Select (list).
 # Configure the attributes with same name in both child object types to have different select option (ex. child object a with options A and B and child object b with option b and c):
# Create a new object in child object type one and one in child object type filling the attribute called attribute:
 !Screenshot 2021-08-09 at 14.15.20.png|thumbnail! 
# Now switch to the main parent object type previously created and in Basic Search, filter for the attribute *attribute* (observe that you can choose between 2).
# Select one of the 2 and pick a value (ex filtering by a value of attribute attribute):
# Observe that at this point you cannot anymore remove the filter cause cross symbol of the filter is not editable/clicable:
 !Screenshot 2021-08-09 at 14.14.52.png|thumbnail! 
# Observe that the only way to remove the filter is to clic on Advanced, manually remove the IQL filter and press Enter:
 !Screenshot 2021-08-09 at 14.15.20-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
Basic search should allow removing the filter
h3. Actual Results
Basic search broken when attribute in different child object types have same name and different options.

h3. Workaround
At the moment the only workaround consist into clicking on Advanced and remove the IQL filter manually.
Note that It is not possible to use the workaround when combining several attributes because the advanced option is disabled.
fields.summary: basic search broken when child object type inherited contains attributes with same name but different select options

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using Insight Post Function *Create an Insight Object from a Jira Issues*, if there is a Jira field with a code block and within it a line break, the content in Insight will be displayed as "_Unknown_".
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an object type and an attribute with Type Value (TextArea) in Insight
 # Use the Insight Post-Function (*Create an Insight Object from a Jira Issue*)
 # Map a Jira field where the code block is stored with the Insight one
 # Trigger the workflow with the Post-Function we just created

h3. Expected Results

Jira field content should be populated in Insight.
h3. Actual Results
 * *If code block contains an extra line break, in Insight shows _Unknown_*

!image-2021-08-09-11-43-04-989.png|width=862,height=223!
 !image-2021-08-09-11-44-01-325.png|width=844,height=307!
 !image-2021-08-09-11-46-05-086.png|width=603,height=193!

 
 * *If code block does not contain an extra line break, Insight will display the values successfully.*

!image-2021-08-09-11-48-25-754.png|width=844,height=253!

!image-2021-08-09-11-54-01-889.png|width=800,height=240!
  
h3. Workaround

Workaround for now is to remove all line break from the Jira field.
fields.summary: Insight attribute shows 'Unknown' when creating an Insight Object from a Jira Issue with a code block, plus an extra line break

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition

By default, when importing objects and concatenating values from multiple datalocators, the default concatenator is space. However, it is not possible to ignore the concatenator and not use any value (e.g. so that "ABC" and "1234" together become "ABC1234").
h3. Suggested resolution

Add option to disable concatenator completely, so the values are concatenated without any character in between.
h3. Workaround
 * Create the desired value right on the source side, example:
 ** If using database as a source, create a new column that contains concatenated values from other desired column values (without space), then use that new column as a datalocator.
 ** If using CSV as a source, open the file in Excel (or other spreadsheet editor) and use CONCATENATE function to generate a desired value in a new column, then use that generated column as a datalocator.
 * Use Insight Automation rule, that would execute a Groovy script which would find if there is a space in the object attribute and remove it.
 ** Community blog that provides an example Groovy script: [Groovy script to remove default concatenator after importing Insight objects |https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-Service-Management-articles/Groovy-script-to-remove-default-concatenator-after-importing/ba-p/1782832]
fields.summary: Add option to remove the concatenator completely when importing objects

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-597].
  {panel}

# define a request type in a customer portal
# add a field (for instance 'Description') and set a custom 'Display name' (for instance ('Any additional details you can provide?')
# go to the customer portal
# raise a request
# go to the JIRA issue
# it would be convenient, from a customer service team member point of view, to know the exact question the customer was asked next to this field. This could be done by adding display name next to the field name. In this case: {quote}*Description* (Any additional details you can provide?){quote}. Alternatively, it could be added in a tool tip.
fields.summary: Display next to the field name in JIRA the 'Display name' which has been set in the customer portal for the pertaining request

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Insight custom field value selection is not accesible in the screen when the transition was triggered from dashboard. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install Jira (tested on 8.5.4 - prior to the bundled app)
# Install Insight 8.7.12 
# Create a new project with sample data eg: Insight IT Service Management
# Edit the (any) screen(s) to include Insight custom fields
# Create a new dashboard
# Create a new filter for the sample project eg: {{project = IISM}}
# Add the 'Filter Results' gadget into the new dashboard and configure it to use the filter
# Trigger a transition via the _3 dots_ - see screenshot below 
!Dashboard-Transition-Trigger.png|thumbnail!
# Access the issue in a new tab
# Trigger the transition again
!IssueView-Transition-Screen.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results
Insight custom field values are accessible

h3. Actual Results
Insight custom field values are not accessible
!Dashboard-Transition-Screen.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround
Perform the transition in the issue view
fields.summary: Insight custom field value selection is not accessible in transition screen when triggered in dashboard

fields.description: After implementing insight, it appears that there is no way to specify a default value for an object attribute. Or in another common case, I have a Boolean field that most objects should have selected as NO, but by default, the field is empty.  I can require it to be entered, but then it just forces the user to need to select one more thing on the form, when most of the time the default would be good enough.

fields.description: Insights have good reference based custom fields available in JIRA. However, the type of these fields is somewhat limited (checkboxes, radio buttons etc.). When build Asset Management onboarding/offboarding solutions, management is looking for more dynamic interaction with these fields on the customer portal. Currently that seems limited, which interferes with user experience. For example:- User select an object type: Drop Box- Next user selects type of access: read/write (could be dynamic list)- Next user should only see objects within DropBox with selected access typeToday this type of multi level cascading support is not available it seems. Also clients want to check what all assets they want to request as part of onboarding followed by selecting the details around each of these assets. In the current framework, this means a fixed list on screen or different form per asset. Suggestions?

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Hello,¬†I am testing Jira Insight module for purposes of CMDB. We have 2 basic use cases:¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Top-down analysis = I want to identify all objects (application, cluster, server, etc.) related to a specific business service¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Bottom-up analysis = I want to identify all business services which might be affected by a specific object (application, cluster, server, etc.)¬†Typically, a service tree (with business service¬†on the top and physical devices at the bottom) are very complex and might consist of many levels and huge number of (any type) objects. Visual representation of the tree is crucial for manual processing by humans. View Object Graph works well until the service tree starts to be complicated or consists of too many objects. ¬†Is there any way how to limit or filter visual representation of the service tree in more sophisticated level than just configuration of reference depth, number of inbound references or types of reference?¬†I would really appreciate if I could:¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Collapse / hide particular branches of the service tree ‚Äì I can set reference depth to 1 and go down in the structure, but once I expand some branch (and realize I do not need it) I cannot collapse it anymore.¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Show only references in the appropriate direction ‚Äì When I go down in the structure and expand an object, I can see all his directly related objects no matter what direction their relation is.¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Show only objects of a specific types, e.g. I want to see only server objects related directly or indirectly (transitively) on a specific business service.¬†Is there project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Hi,I'm currently evaluating Insight (along with JIRA Service Desk) as a possible replacement to our current ITSM solution and am very impressed so far about it's ease of use and flexibility :-).One thing I'm struggling with tough is that IQL is limited in its expressiveness (at least of what I can see at https://documentation.riada.se/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=13573623).Here are some concrete use cases I had during LDAP and CSV imports where I'd need some string manipulation possibilities:* LDAP import: Remove the first part of an LDAP distinguishedName (e.g. remove "cn=someuser," from "cn=someuser,ou=unit1,dc=example,dc=com" so I can create a reference to the object represented by "ou=unit1,dc=example,dc=com")* CSV Import: object1 consists of 2 fields: name, path; object 2 consists of 2 fields: name, path; I'd like to create a reference from object2 to object1 using object2.path=object1.path + "\" + object1.nameIn general I'd expect the following possibilities to be usable in IQL:* String concatenation* String splitting and joining using delimiter* Different ways to build substrings * See https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-lang/apidocs/org/apache/commons/lang3/StringUtils.html for inspiration* Substitution, RegEx matching, Search/Replace* Convert to lowercase/Uppercase/lowerCamelCase/UpperCamelCase/words-with-dashes/words_with_underscores* Replace special characters to generate safe words for URLs, filenames, ...* Encode/decode strings (e.g. urlencode/urldecode, HTML/XML, JSON, base64)* IP address and netmask matching and manipulation* Math functions (add, substract, multiply, divide, power, exponent)* More boolean expressions (NOT and OR)* Bitwise operators (AND, OR, XOR)* Maybe more I did not yet think of ;-)If the use cases I mentioned above are already possible in a way I had not seen, please let me know.Thanks,Andreas
fields.summary: More expressive IQL functions

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: h2. Use caseI want to be able to update my user attribute which has cardinality unlimited as a maximum value. I have 400 users in that attribute. To remove one value, I have to send a list of 399 names instead of sending one name to be removed. This is due to the drawback of the PUT methodh2. ProposalAdd a DELETE/PATCH method in the REST API to allow performing this task more smoothly.
fields.summary: REST - Cannot update a single attribute value in a maxed cardinality attributeType

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: h3. Improvement Requesth3. Steps to reproduce: # have an Object Type with a reference Attribute - Type Value: Object and select a Reference Type as the Additional Value, e.g. "Belongs" # Navigate to Object Schema>Configure>References Tab # Change the "Belongs" Reference name to something else - e.g. "Related to" # go back to the Object type>Attributes Tab and see the Attribute's Additional Valueh3. Expected result:The reference set in step 1 is now showing "Related to"h3. Actual result:The reference set in step 1 is still showing "Belongs"h3. Workaround:Re-index Insight, and refresh the browser after 2 min. had passed (cache was refreshed) and the Reference will show as "Related to" now.¬†
fields.summary: updating Reference Names does not update Object Types right away

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: We have a project going on with the need to get resources scheduled. It is not a calendar per se but a resource view/app with which one can schedule jobs and the resources required to complete the work. We would be interested in getting in touch with your people to find out what Insight can provide on the API level and what functionalities we need to implement ourselves.For example, it would be great to be able to use IQL to search for "all resources of type vehicle with diesel engine, available between yyyy-mm-dd and yyyy-mm-dd+2".In this particular context, a calendar as such is not enough. Or "calendar" like the way Office365 calendars work. Resource calendar will work for some of their use cases, like when you need special equipment or vehicles to be available and reserved for a particular "gig". That is one type of resource lock, i.e. the resource is _locked_ for a time period and needs to be _released_ before it is available for further use. Maybe the resource (again, vehicle or equipment) could be attached to another Insight object (or JIRA issue) between two timestamps. Or something... My thinking around this is not too clear yet and you probably have a number of approaches in mind based on the feature requests received from the field.Anyway, if you end up having a functional scheduling method for, say, electricians, plumbers, vehicles or such, you will¬†have a lot of potential customers from the public sector and from companies (small to large).----I am interested in hearing about your plans related to calendaring, how much of the customer's requirements can be covered by your existing or future features, and how much we need to build on top of Insight's features ourselves.
fields.summary: Resource calendar / booking

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

Perfect would be: Display a filtered result List after easy-search (as in the iql search)

fields.description: A neat feature would be if you could "disable" the history for a certain Object Types or Attributes*The main use-case is:*I have an Object Type that is updated on an hourly basis with info about the JIRA projects in the instance.The object type contains attributes like Name, Key, Issue Types, Number of Tickets etc.Each hour the object is updated and usually the attribute "Number of Tickets" has changed and this creates a history bean. The history will over time grow a lot with this behavior.The actual history for the number of tickets attribute is really not interesting here and it should be cool if I could mark this attribute as excluded from the History. If this is hard to achieve the second best solution would be to be able to exclude the entire object type from the history.Or both (that would be awesome!)Cheers,// Svante
fields.summary: Possibility to suppress History for certain Object Types (or even attributes)

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: {color:#1F497D}Good Afternoon, Northrop Grumman Aerospace in Melbourne Florida is very interested in the Insight tool, we have a couple of questions/requests that we would like to get some clarification on and have not been able to get a response, can you please help me with this?{color} {color:#1F497D}¬†{color} {color:#1F497D}Security and user privileges (custom roles) is a significant point for us. You said in your email that it was one feature that you will probably work on in future releases. If you do end up implementing these in a future release, would it be possible to include the following:{color} {color:#1F497D}¬∑{color}{color:#1F497D}¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†{color} {color:#1F497D}Ability to restrict user to only view certain objects in an object type{color} {color:#1F497D}¬∑{color}{color:#1F497D}¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†{color} {color:#1F497D}Ability to restrict users rights to edit, move, or delete objects based on their user level{color} {color:#1F497D}¬∑{color}{color:#1F497D}¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†{color} {color:#1F497D}Restrict users from viewing certain objects based on their tie to other objects unless they have the rights to view that item{color} {color:#1F497D}¬∑{color}{color:#1F497D}¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†{color} {color:#1F497D}Restrict users from viewing certain object attributes based on their user level{color} {color:#1F497D}¬†{color} {color:#1F497D}If there is a way to obtain these already inside of Insight, I would love to hear more information about how it would be done with the current system or similar software. Please let me know if there are any ways to do this. I am looking forward to seeing what Insight 5.0 is releasing.{color} ¬† ¬†  *Drew Schaefer* Manager, CDM Manned C2ISR and AP-12 (Acting) Northrop Grumman Corp Phone ‚Äì 321.951.6629 Cell ‚Äì 321.507-9174 [Andrew.schaefer@ngc.com|mailto:Andrew.schaefer@ngc.com] ¬† ¬†
fields.summary: Improved Permissions

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Currently, when I export an object schema it includes the schema and the objects, but not the import object type mapping (or maybe even other parts of the object schema configuration). That way the import / export feature can be used for backup/restore or preparing object schemas on a test system and transporting it later to a production system - including every aspect of the schema, like:
* General configuration* References* Statuses* Icons* Roles* Import* Automation* Label Templates* Files

Best would be if one could select, which parts should be part of the export. And for the import it should be possible too to select the configuration parts that should be imported from the configuration.
fields.summary: Object Schema Import / Export should include parts of the object schema configuration (esp. import object type mapping)

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Hello,it would be nice to be able to combine multiple attributes for display in select lists and search.This would make it easier to find the right entry.Ideally this should work for Integer fields too.Insight Version 5 has this label feature which goes in this direction (select what attribute to display) but bot far enough.Best regards,Michael
fields.summary: Ability to display multiple attributes in select lists
